definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
fowl/chicken/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(slang) prostitute
dog/Kangxi radical 94
(negative prefix)/not/no
would rather/to prefer/how (emphatic)/Taiwan pr. [ning2]
abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning

peaceful/to pacify/to visit (one's parents etc)
variant of 寧|宁[ning2]

sentences.english: The two sisters always quarrels like cat and dog.
sentences.chinese: 她们姐妹俩在一起就鸡犬不宁，老是吵架。

sentences.english: He lives a cat and dog life.
sentences.chinese: 他过着鸡犬不宁的生活。

sentences.english: The enemy troops put the whole village in a big turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 敌军闹得全村鸡犬不宁。

sentences.english: Ep753 - Meiyu successfully stays in Jinsheng's house. She plans to create problems for the Wu family.
sentences.chinese: 美玉顺利住进金生家里，打算把吴家搞到鸡犬不宁。

sentences.english: And it was Albert Einstein who set the cat among the pigeons.
sentences.chinese: 它是爱因斯坦谁设置业界鸡犬不宁。

sentences.english: Since their marriage the couple have been living a cat-and-dog life.
sentences.chinese: 结婚后他们的生活总是鸡犬不宁。

sentences.english: The whole village is suffered from the enemy army.
sentences.chinese: 敌军闹得全村鸡犬不宁。
